snippet: The assertion by Navi Pillay, the high commissioner for human rights, about President Bashar al-Assad was based on what she called information amassed by her panel of investigators.
abstract: Navi Pillay, top United Nations human rights official, links Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad to war crimes and crimes against humanity for the first time; Pillay cites evidence collected by her panel of investigators over the course of the 33-month-old conflict in the country.

byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The assertion by Navi Pillay, the high commissioner for human rights, about President Bashar al-Assad was based on what she called information amassed by her panel of investigators.
